title: Mysterious Keen Dreams version?
content:
I have stubled on a very strange version of Keen Dreams. The start screen of the game looks like this:
[img]http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/kdreams.gif[/img]
For first, I'm not sure wether it's a shareware or a registered version of the game. At first I thought it was registered, but now that I looked through it, everything in the game is the same as the shareware version is using, shareware ending text and shareware title screen. The only difference that I've noticed in-game is that the title screen says SoftDisk Publishing Presents instead of the normal Gamer's Edge Presents.

Has anyone else discovered this version? I could put it up for download, but as I don't know if it's shareware or registered I probably have to make a patch for the registered version of Keen Dreams to change it into this one.

I have also found version 1.3 (not 1.31) of Commander Keen 1 - Marooned on Mars. It can be downloaded from here: [url=http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/1keen13.zip]real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/1keen13.zip[/url]

EDIT:
Okay, here's the link for the mysterious keen dreams version:
[url=http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/kdreams.zip]real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/kdreams.zip[/url]

title: Nifty.
content:
Interesting. I wonder if it could be the original version that was released by Softdisk back when it was first made.

Where exactly did you find these?

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
The files are dated 1993, so according to those it would be a later release than the original shareware releases, but of course the dates could be the wrong ones. I found it by googling "Keen Dreams", but I don't have the URL to the site anymore and besides there was some illegal stuff there so I wouldn't have been allowed to put the link here netherless.

I would like to know wether I'm allowed to upload it and put a link here or not!

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Woah, this seems pretty interesting.. I guess it's shareware if everything is just like in the shareware version, as the title screen (for example) is different in shareware and registered versions.
And Keen 1 1.3?! Never even heard of that, cool!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Okay, I decided to upload it and let everyone else try it.
You can download it from here: [url=http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/kdreams.zip]real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/kdreams.zip[/url]
Feel free to remove the link if you don't want it posted here!

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Nice find.

That makes this the third 'distinctly' different Keen Dreams version (the 'common' version, the one with the 'extended' story and this one). I wonder if there's any others floating around out there...

title: Re: Nifty.
content: Is the "extended story" version the same as the registered one?

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Uh... I have had that version for a long time. If I knew it was a less common version... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dead.gif[/img] ___________________
DaVince, Yet Another Amateur Game Creator! :P

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Well so far we have 3 versions:

Shareware : Shorter story, shorter help and credits text. Titlescreen in external file, shows advertisements on startup.

'Full' : Much fewer files, more text, cleaner startup

The new one: Definitely the origional one, I've checked the files; this is KD before it was messed with.

According to what I can see; this was the origional code, the Keen7 and shareware versions have had this code nipped and tucked and fiddled with. I'd say what happened was that a hastily fiddled one became the shareware, while one with a bit more effort became the 'full' version.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
Yeah. There probably is some engine but the songs never made to the actual game. Didn't they make some soundtrack but then just got to hear that the game must fit in [insert exact amount of kilobytes here]. Again, can't remember this for sure, it may be my mind is remembering things that weren't.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Nifty.
content: Yes, I seem to recall the game actually had music, but they had to remove it so it would fit on a 360K floppy.  Shame they never kept it...  Although I also thought they reused some of it in later Keen games, e.g. "Eat Your Veggies" in Keen 4.

title: Re: Nifty.
content:
It's on [url=http://www.dopefish.com/]Dopefish.com[/url] under "Dopefish music".
As far as I know that is the only piece of music that was salvaged from Dreams, but perhaps Bobby Prince never got to make any other music?
CK4 came out first after KD, and it didn't have that many different pieces, so I doubt KD was supposed to have a lot before it got removed either.

I remember trying getting the music to work in KD, obviously to no avail.
It isn't on 3DR's support page for Keen, so actually I think BP is the only reason it is known that that song originally came from KD.
In other words, we'd have to ask him, or someone else of the original id crew about other songs.
Speaking of which, a good idea would be to ask about the official song names for all the songs, as some are still unknown.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Mysterious Keen Dreams version?
content:
Hmm, I seem to own this one too. I liked me some Keen back in the day =)

I purchased it retail, it said nothing about being shareware. I could likely get a box scan too... anyhow:

Here's an image of the disk:
[img]http://img134.imageshack.us/img134/5663/kdreamsdiskunedited2qh.jpg[/img]

And here's a disk-image (.IMZ/zipped .IMG, for WinImage/etc):
[url=http://rapidshare.de/files/21408601/KDREAMSimage.zip.html]rapidshare.de/files/21408...e.zip.html[/url]
(Rapidshare, will die after 30days of no downloads; get it while you can; the .IMZ itself is zipped to preserve the long filename.)

I'm pretty sure the above disk-image is a full version, currently unavailable commercially, and thus 'abandonware'.

So yeah, with that over; anyone for a box scan?

title: Re: Mysterious Keen Dreams version?
content:
Something I found interesting; I read in this thread about there being little or no music...

The back of the box proudly advertises there being a "stirring soundtrack". I didn't have a soundcard back in these days, so I can't say one way or another; but the .IMZ above is from this same retail release, so it's either there, or they lied.

Perhaps it needs some non-standard soundblaster/adlib IRQ/DMA? Just a thought. =)

- RG

title: Re: Mysterious Keen Dreams version?
content:

title: Re: Mysterious Keen Dreams version?
content:
It seems like there was two releases of this version as well, the other one has special tips & tricks included with the release. It has complete walkthroughs and then a lot of technical support stuff included. Get it here:
[url=http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/newkdream.zip]real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/newkdream.zip[/url]
That makes it the fifth Keen Dreams version! Seems like Softdisk didn't get pleased with their releases easily...

Here's a screenshot from the title screen:
[img]http://real_hotdog.sitesled.com/Pictures/nkdream.png[/img]

Remember to lauch the game using START.BAT or otherwise nothing special can be seen!
